node.title: Mexico to Allow U.S. ‘Remain in Mexico’ Asylum Policy to Resume
node.description: A judge had ordered the Biden administration to restart the Trump-era program, but doing so required cooperation from Mexico, which had been reluctant until now.

node.title: Former Ohio Deputy Is Indicted in Fatal Shooting of Columbus Man
node.description: The former deputy, Jason Meade, was a member of a fugitive task force when he shot Casey Goodson Jr., 23, who was not the target of the operation, according to the indictment. He faces two murder counts.

node.title: Scientists say they may have found the way AstraZeneca’s vaccine can cause rare blood clots.
node.description: The findings suggest that the problem is linked to the shot’s use of another, harmless virus to deliver information into human cells.

node.title: New Binary Star Type Discovered is The 'Missing Link' In Stellar Evolution
node.description: The discovery could finally explain how a type of stellar remnant called extremely low mass white dwarfs form, something that has puzzled scientists for decades.

node.title: Male Caimans Sing to Females for Love
node.description: The caiman courtship strategy was filmed for the Discovery+ series "The Mating Game."

node.title: Omicron COVID Variant Outbreak at Christmas Party Infects 60 People
node.description: If confirmed, the infections that followed an event in Oslo could be the biggest single outbreak recorded of the new COVID variant.

node.title: South Korea Has Record Number of COVID Patients Deemed Serious or Critical
node.description: In South Korea, there are 733 patients who are deemed to be in serious or critical condition and the COVID-19 ICU's are at 90 percent capacity.

node.title: Israel to Use Phones to Track Individuals Confirmed to Have Omicron Variant
node.description: Israel had been using the technology on and off since March 2020 to curb the spread of the pandemic, but civil rights groups blasted the measure.

node.title: Germany Bans Unvaccinated From Nonessential Stores, Could Enact National Mandate
node.description: "The situation in our country is serious," said outgoing German Chancellor Angela Merkel during a press conference.

node.title: Man Who Attended NYC Anime Convention Becomes Minnesota's First Omicron Case
node.description: Officials worry the Omicron variant is more transmissible and could potentially reduce the effectiveness of vaccines and therapeutics.

node.title: Ohio Deputy Charged a Year After Fatally Shooting Casey Goodson Jr. in Front of Children
node.description: Franklin County Sheriff's Deputy Jason Meade was indicted Thursday on two charges of murder and one count of reckless homicide in the fatal shooting of Casey Goodson, Jr.

node.title: U.S. and China Top Military Officials Set to Meet Over Increasing Arms Race
node.description: Hong Kong's South China Morning Post reported that talks were agreed on during last month's highly watched summit between Joe Biden and Xi Jinping.

node.title: The T List: Holiday Gift Guide, Part I
node.description: Kitschy ornaments, handwoven throws, a pine-scented essential oil — and more.

node.title: For Andy Warhol, Faith and Sexuality Intertwined
node.description: The Brooklyn Museum shows how Catholicism seeped into his art, complicating our view of the Pop master.

node.title: An Ex-Journalist, a Philosophy Major and the Mad Scramble for Video Game Consoles
node.description: New gaming consoles remain in short supply this holiday season, spawning cottage industries of tipsters and scalpers making money off their scarcity.

node.title: Lawmakers Strike Spending Deal but Government Shutdown Still Looms
node.description: Even as the House set a Thursday vote to fund the government through February, Senate Republicans were still threatening to force a shutdown over vaccine mandates.

node.title: Meghan Wins Legal Battle Against The Mail on Sunday
node.description: An appeals court rejected a bid to force a trial over the duchess’s claim that the tabloid violated her privacy by publishing an anguished letter she sent to her estranged father.

node.title: Omicron Variant May Have Spread From Animal to Human, Scientists Suggest
node.description: Scientists say it is plausible the variant of concern emerged from an animal host, but its origins are still unclear.

node.title: COVID Cases Are Falling in the Five Least Vaccinated States
node.description: West Virginia, which is only 42 percent fully vaccinated, has seen its daily average of new cases fall by 7 percent over the last 14 days,

node.title: Cost of Living in the Midst of the Great Depression Baffles the Internet: 'Incredible'
node.description: A price breakdown for 1938 reveals that a new house cost $3,900, while rent was $27 a month.

node.title: Trump Denies Melania Is Refusing to Return to White House if He Wins in 2024
node.description: Trump called it "not true" that Melania is enjoying private life and isn't interested in returning to Washington, D.C.,

node.title: Biden Administration Resuming Trump's 'Remain in Mexico' Policy Starting Next Week
node.description: The revived policy comes after intense negotiations between the U.S. and Mexico.

node.title: "Mystery" prehistoric footprints re-excavated for second look
node.description: When famed paleontologist Mary Leakey first uncovered the footprints in Tanzania 40 years ago, the evidence was ambiguous.

node.title: Hours after Chinese boycott, IOC speaks to star player Peng Shuai
node.description: The IOC said that "a team" from the committee held a video call with Peng, but it did not outline what was discussed or provide any photos or video.

node.title: Inflation causing hardship for almost half of U.S. households
node.description: New Gallup survey also finds that more Republicans than Democrats are feeling the pinch from higher prices.

node.title: House lawmakers reach deal on funding bill to avoid government shutdown
node.description: The bill funds the government through February 18, and includes $7 billion to held resettle Afghan refugees.

node.title: "Mountain of digital evidence" suggests school shooting was planned
node.description: Tate Myre was one of the four teenagers killed​ on Tuesday when a student opened fire at a Michigan high school.

node.title: 5 Tips for Avoiding Surprise Virus Test Bills
node.description: Experts worry the Omicron variant could seed a new coronavirus wave, which would probably mean a lot more surprise bills.

node.title: Mothers of Reinvention: The Lab Pivots as Studios Close
node.description: In a strategic feat of survival, the Lab, a Los Angeles dance studio stalwart, has transformed itself into a creative agency and “lifestyle brand.”

node.title: Etel Adnan’s Bittersweet Arrival at the Guggenheim
node.description: The philosopher-artist reveled in nature and in exploring her inner life. The phosphorescence of her work has not dimmed.
